doc.after: The population of Africa has grown rapidly over the past century,[1] and consequently shows a large youth bulge, further reinforced by a low life expectancy of below 50 years in some African countries.[2] The population doubled in the period 1982â2009[3] and quadrupled from 1955â2009, according to United Nations estimates.[4] As of 2013, the total population of Africa is estimated at 1.1 billion, representing approximately 15% of the world's population. [5]
